a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif;font-weight:500

text.tspan: Microplastics in the surface ocean, 1950 to 2050
Microplastics are buoyant plastic materials smaller than 0.5 centimeters in diameter. Future global accumulation in the
surface ocean is shown under three plastic emissions scenarios: (1) emissions to the oceans stop in 2020; (2) they
stagnate at 2020 emission rates; or (3) continue to grow until 2050 in line with historical plastic production rates.
Data source: Lebreton et al. (2019). A global mass budget for positively buoyant macroplastic debris in the ocean.
